title: Ticket #5769: Fix HAD|REPLICATION configuration incompability.
description:
In 8.5.5, working HAD configurations looked something like this: 

HAD_PORT = 12345
HAD_ARGS = -p $(HAD_PORT)
HAD_LIST = $(CM1):$(HAD_PORT), $(CM2):$(HAD_PORT)

The REPLICATION daemon had the same set-up.

In 8.5.6, this configuration needed to change to the following because we wanted shared port to be the default: 

HAD_PORT = 12345
HAD_ARGS = -p $(HAD_PORT)
HAD_LIST = $(CM1):$(HAD_PORT), $(CM2):$(HAD_PORT)
REPLICATION_SOCKET_NAME =
HAD.USE_SHARED_PORT = FALSE

We should work around the need to unset REPLICATION_SOCKET_NAME by changing the relevant HAD code to assume that the replication daemon(s) are using shared port if and only if HAD itself is; it would then become harmless to leave REPLICATION_SOCKET_NAME set to its default ("REPLICATION").

However, setting a subsystem knob in the param table is generally frowned upon as being, at best, counter-intuitive. TJ recommends, instead, that we make HAD_USE_SHARED_PORT and REPLICATION_USE_SHARED_PORT (possibly the latter should default to the former, given the assumption above) first-class configuration knobs respected by the master (for any daemon who shares the HAD or REPLICATION daemon binary) and the HAD and REPLICATION daemons themselves.

We would still have some counter-intuitive behaviour, because USE_SHARED_PORT would no longer control all daemons, but since it currently doesn't control HAD or REPLICATION, this might actually be less confusing than the current set-up.
remarks:
